unnormalised: The Delhi govt. has announced a new scholarship scheme for students from economically weaker sections, offering up to Rs. 50,000 per annum. This initiative aims to boost higher education accessibility, especially benefiting students in fields like engineering and medicine. The scheme, titled 'Udaan,' will be rolled out from 1/7/2024.
normalised: The Delhi government has announced a new scholarship scheme for students from economically weaker sections, offering up to rupee fifty thousand per annum. This initiative aims to boost higher education accessibility, especially benefiting students in fields like engineering and medicine. The scheme, titled 'Udaan,' will be rolled out from first july two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Under Udaan, students scoring above 75% in their Class 12 CBSE exams are eligible. The application process will be entirely online, with forms available on the Delhi education dept.'s website. The last date for submission is 31/08/2024.
normalised: Under Udaan, students scoring above seventy five percent in their Class twelve C-B-S-E exams are eligible. The application process will be entirely online, with forms available on the Delhi education department's website. The last date for submission is thirty first august two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Education Min. Atishi Marlena emphasized the govt's commitment to inclusive education. She highlighted that ~25% of students drop out due to financial constraints. "Udaan will empower these bright minds to achieve their dreams without worrying about money," she stated.
normalised: Education Minister Atishi Marlena emphasized the government's commitment to inclusive education. She highlighted that approximately twenty five percent of students drop out due to financial constraints. "Udaan will empower these bright minds to achieve their dreams without worrying about money," she stated.

unnormalised: The scheme covers tuition fees, hostel charges, and books. Students pursuing professional courses such as MBBS and B.Tech can avail of a higher scholarship amount of Rs 50000, while those in other streams will receive Rs 30,000. This marks a significant investment in the future of Delhi's youth.
normalised: The scheme covers tuition fees, hostel charges, and books. Students pursuing professional courses such as M-B-B-S and B-Tech can avail of a higher scholarship amount of rupee fifty thousand, while those in other streams will receive rupee thirty thousand. This marks a significant investment in the future of Delhi's youth.

unnormalised: This initiative is expected to benefit over 10,000 students in the first year itself. The budget allocated for Udaan is Rs. 20 crore, demonstrating the govt's seriousness in promoting quality education for all, regardless of their economic background. Keep an eye on the official website for more details!
normalised: This initiative is expected to benefit over ten thousand students in the first year itself. The budget allocated for Udaan is rupee twenty crore, demonstrating the government's seriousness in promoting quality education for all, regardless of their economic background. Keep an eye on the official website for more details!
